channel.title: image analytics on Orange
channel.description: Recent content in image analytics on Orange

item.title: Data Mining for Archaeologists, part I
item.description: Recently, we held a workshop for a group of archaeologists. While archaeologists are quite well-versed in quantitative analysis, data science was still quite new for most of the participants. Our aim was to introduce basic data science concepts through archaeological use cases. One such case that came to our mind was predicting a type of the artefact from the image. Related: Data Mining for Anthropologists We took three best-documented amphora types (types with the highest number of images) from the Archaeology Data Service portal.

item.title: Clustering of Monet and Manet
item.description: Ever had a hard time telling the difference between Claude Monet and Ã‰douard Manet? Orange can help you cluster these two authors and even more, discover which of Monet’s masterpiece is indeed very similar to Manet’s! Use Image Analytics add-on and play with it. Here’s how:
